title: Documentation for using CMake with `lfort`
body:
*Original issue*: https://gitlab.com/lfortran/lfortran/-/issues/150

Right now, I'm resorting to

```
$ cmake \
>     -DCMAKE_Fortran_COMPILER_ID=LFort \
>     -DCMAKE_Fortran_COMPILER="${LFORT_BIN}" \
>     -DCMAKE_BUILD_TYPE=Release \
>     -DCMAKE_INSTALL_PREFIX:PATH="${INSTALL_PREFIX}" \
>     -DCMAKE_VERBOSE_MAKEFILE:BOOL=ON \
>     -S "${SRC_DIR}" \
>     -B "${BUILD_DIR}"
-- The Fortran compiler identification is LFort
-- The C compiler identification is Clang 5.0.0
-- Check for working Fortran compiler: .../miniconda3/bin/lfort
-- Check for working Fortran compiler: .../miniconda3/bin/lfort  -- works
-- Detecting Fortran compiler ABI info
-- Detecting Fortran compiler ABI info - failed
-- Checking whether .../miniconda3/bin/lfort supports Fortran 90
-- Checking whether .../miniconda3/bin/lfort supports Fortran 90 -- yes
-- Check for working C compiler: .../miniconda3/bin/clang
-- Check for working C compiler: .../miniconda3/bin/clang -- works
-- Detecting C compiler ABI info
-- Detecting C compiler ABI info - done
-- Detecting C compile features
-- Detecting C compile features - done
...
```

but am not sure if there is a more official way to go about this. The

```
Detecting Fortran compiler ABI info - failed
```

message is a bit worrisome, but I'm not sure what it indicates. Also note that without faking the `-DCMAKE_Fortran_COMPILER_ID=LFort` flag, since `lfort` isn't among the [known (by CMake) compilers][1], the configure step prints

```
-- The Fortran compiler identification is unknown
```

----

I feel like there is a CMake story already for this project since you use CMake to build `lfortran` (:fingers_crossed:). I'd be happy to help contribute to `docs.lfortran.org` if there is some recommended way to do build projects with CMake + `lfort`.

Cheers and thanks for this great project!

[1]: https://github.com/Kitware/CMake/blob/d31f31714bb0b4e027ed99998e5f90ebe52d9304/Modules/CMakeDetermineFortranCompiler.cmake#L46-L64
